alert.note: Alert for De Kalb (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 9:25AM CDT until August 10 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following areas, De Kalb and northern and western La Salle. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Up to 2 to 3.5 inches have fell in parts of northern and western DeKalb Counties since early this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches, including brief very heavy rainfall rates, are expected over parts of DeKalb and LaSalle Counties the remainder of the morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kirkland, DeKalb, Sycamore, Peru, La Salle, Sandwich, Mendota, Genoa, Sheridan, Shabbona, Lake Holiday, Cortland, Oglesby, Hinckley, Somonauk, Kirkland, Earlville, Waterman, North Utica, Maple Park and Malta. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
